data.title: Not what we payed for.
data.text:
Make sure that you are getting one of the "regular" sized rooms that are shown and advertised. We some how came up with the only "smaller" room. It was so crowded and freezing the whole time we where there. If you closed the bedroom door or bathroom there was frost that built up on the inside of the window. The microwave made a sound that sounded like it would exsplode at anytime and when we told "management" they said oh yah its broken we'll be ordering one. Also several floor boards coming up and I actually cut my foot. The sheets had a whole in them the coverlet was covered with stains and the window curtains where all broken and couldn't be closed. Towel rod coming off the wall oh yes and my favorite. No NO extra toilet paper rolls and there was maybe a fourth of a roll left when we came. No garbage sacks, no hand soap, listed this and more, and when we where able to get ahold of the manager, she said oh I will have to talk to the owners about compensation.(OK how about you just fixing the problems and some good old fashion customer service) Oh goodie ! And they did a whopping 30.00!!!!!!! We are from Billings and wont be suggesting or care to grace the doors of the Carlin Hotel. To bad it could have been such a wonderful hotel had it been what was described and shown in the pictures. Whoever owns and operates the Hotel I think its time for some personal one on one with each of your eight rooms. 
So unhappy.

data.title: Extended Stay
data.text:
Fantastic place to stay, especially if you stay longer. Manager Stephanie is very friendly and helpfull. Kitchen and seperate bedroom, nice couch and two tv's. Laundry possible. Much privacy. Nightclub NV was closed down when I stayed here, I don't know what the noise will be if it will be reopened (if ever). Weekprice is very reasonable. Downtown in a nice little street with galeries. Pub at the other side. Lots of restaurants in walking distance. The best I had in Billings, really. It beats the Clocktower Inn. 
One tip: if you need an extra bed to put in the livingroom, you might as well buy an airbed in the Wallmart, that is only 25 dollars and works better the the extra bed in the hotel you can rent for 20 dollars a day or 53 per week.

data.title: Business travelers thoroughly enjoyed the Carlin Hotel
data.text: Our group booked 5 of the rooms at the Carlin Hotel for two weeks in September.  Stephanie, the manager, made us feel welcome immediately.  A spectacular alternative to the Crowne Plaza. The rooms are spacious, clean, with full kitchen, newly appointed bathrooms, comfortable beds.  There was plenty of space in 304 in which to set up a warroom of business activity, complete with our laptops, two printers, and boxes of court trial materials.  With no hotel reservation receptionist, we did hire a messenger to assist us in transporting our boxes of materials from the Fed Express office on 27th avenue to our hotel.  Cody, our messenger, was superb-- 406-652-1182 if you wish to hire him.  I cannot praise enough the Fed Ex employees, who created blowups, boxes, copies and shipped things for us.  Unbelievably great service -- 406-252-6265. See the addtl reviewer's comments re Saturday night noise from the nightclub, and on one Saturday nite the reverberations were intense, but we found the entire experience to be excellent.  Trains passing did not bother any of us. Visit LILAC for delicious food, and McCormicks for tasty breakfasts, so very close by.  I would definitely pick the Carlin even for a single overnight visit.

data.title: Club Carlin -- We used to love it until...
data.text:
We have frequented the martini bar a night or two a month for a couple years. After 10pm they charge a cover fee of $3 (I guess to pay the DJ??). On our last visit (and it will be our last visit ever) the lady at the door that takes the cover and issues wrist bands put a band on one of our friends wrists whom immediately announced it was a little tight for his comfort. She put her finger under it and said if her finger fits it is fine. (Who is she to determine what another persons comfort level is?) 

Anyway, she stated if your band comes off, you will be charged the cover again. I can see them saying that to minimize hassles of re-issuing a band. 

The band was bothering our friend and, as he fidgeted with it, it popped apart. We thought, no big deal. Just go up and get it replaced (especially since he initially stated it was uncomfortable so she should remember him). 

Well, she charged him $3 again knowing good we he had already paid. 

Considering their drinks are certainly not a bargain and we typically spend $70+ each visit on drinks alone, we felt they were being petty to charge for a replacement wrist band in this case. 

Anyway, it seemed petty to us and not an example of good customer service so we are not patronizing them anymore. 

So if you are on the lookout for businesses that put their customers first, join us in taking your business elsewhere.

data.title: GREAT place with one detail that you might not like
data.text: The "hotel" is actually the 3rd floor of a renovated building on Montana Avenue - a trendy street renovated and now occupied by shops, eating establishment, and nighclubs.  The 2nd floor is occupied by businesses renting rooms for offices.  And then there is the 1st floor.  Q Cuisine is a stylish restaurant offering a variety of items but I remember some of the focus was on pasta.  The St. Louis ribs are very unique.  The meat was cooked perfectly but the heavy orange flavored BBQ sauce was a bit overpowering.  Also on the 1st floor, next to the Q, is the Carlin nightclub.  The venue changes to whom they cater depending on the night.  And here is where the problem lies....depending on the room, you can here the music pumping over the speakers.  Some of the guys I went on my work trip work swore that pictures on the wall rattled.  I could hear it in room 308 which is in the back but it only affected me 1 night as far as staying asleep.  If you are a light sleeper and are staying here, you HAVE to stay in one of the front 2 rooms. The only down side is the train that goes through town (see Crown Plaza reviews regarding train noise in Billings).  On a plus side, if you stay there, you never pay a cover.  The staff at both places are super nice and will learn to know you by name....always a great little aspect if you are miles away from home.

data.title: Best Place to Stay in Billings-Not Your Typical Hotel!
data.text: The Carlin has CLASS! It is called Billings only Extended Stay hotel, but there are daily rates as well. The hotel once served railroad passengers and has been completly restored preserving some of the hardwood flooring and staircase. Each of the 8 rooms is decorated with a "modern" flair and has a kitchenette and a separate bedroom and beautifully tiled bathroom. Each room is well appointed and decorated with photographs of Billings area businesses. Luxurious down pillows and bedding, and oversized bath towels! One GREAT feature of the hotel is the attached restaurant and separate night club/Martini Bar. They have regularly scheduled entertainment/music/bands (see their website for schedule and restaurant menu) and draws the "trendy" hip crowd. It is located on Montana Ave. just down from the Sheraton. If I return to Billings, I would not even consider staying anywhere else. I'm glad that I discoved The Carlin - It's not your standard issue hotel! For the overall quality of the accomodations, the rates a VERY good.
